thread.title: ‘Jersey Boys’ set to kick off America's Thanksgiving Parade
thread.title_full: ‘Jersey Boys’ set to kick off America's Thanksgiving Parade

author: detroitnews.com
title: ‘Jersey Boys’ set to kick off America's Thanksgiving Parade
text:
The Broadway musical “Jersey Boys” will be at the Fisher Theatre Nov. 17-Dec. 6. (Photo: Jeremy Daniel) 
19 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Before the 89th America’s Thanksgiving Parade kicks off in Detroit this year, spectators will be treated to a live performance from award-winning Broadway musical “Jersey Boys.”
The production, which has won Tony, Grammy and Olivier awards, is the story of Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons. “Jersey Boys” is in town at the Fisher Theatre Nov. 17-Dec. 6. Before the parade, members of the cast will sing in the TV zone before the parade marches down Woodward from Kirby to Congress. The TV zone is at Woodward and Grand River.
This year’s parade theme is “So Happy Together,” and comedian and Michigan native Tim Allen is set to be the Grand Marshall.
America’s Thanksgiving Parade will take place the morning of Nov. 26. It will broadcast on WDIV-TV and on WJR-AM from 10 a.m.-noon. Grandstand tickets, $35-$60, are on sale now at theparade.org.
mbaetens@detroitnews.com
